captions.text:
I am walking among people
with the familiar scent, hoping you to be there.

As if the time has stopped,
in faint memories, I stop and look around.

Without me knowing,
my heart is beating again.

I think my heart remembers
the scent of the perfume.

Other people would not know.
You would not the only person using it.
Only I am stopped by that common scent.

Your scent that made me sad.
Your scent that made me stop.

It reminds me our love,
our memories one by one.

It keeps coming up. Your scent.
Your scent that made me miss you.

It makes me more painful
and my tears run down.

I miss you who left me alone so much
that I am standing here.

I guess the memories I thought
I completely forgot are reminded
by that perfume.
Other people would not know. You would not the only person using it.
Only I am stopped by that common scent.
Your scent that made me sad. Your scent that made me stop.

It reminds me our love, 
memories one by one.

It keeps coming up. Your scent.
Your scent that made me miss you.

It makes me more painful
and my tears run down.

I miss you who left me alone so much
that I am standing here.

The hurtful memories
by hurtful love getting blurred
They find me again and make me cry.
What should I do to forget you?

It keeps coming up. Your scent.
Your scent that made me miss you.

It makes me more painful
and my tears run down.

I miss you who left me alone so much
that I am standing here.
I am standing here.

comments.author: Karen Garcia

comments.text:
The Korean word "향수" does mean perfume, as the title states, but also has 
an alternative meaning, which is "nostalgia." The lyrics, specifically the 
chorus verse, allude to the "smell" of the woman how and to the "memories" 
the smell brings. So I think, as you interpreted, the male protagonist lost 
his woman due to a tragic matter, rather than a mundane dumping incident.
